author: T Madhavan
text:
Eight class VI students sustain minor injuries in incident

Parents of students want the authorities of Sri Sankara Vidyalaya school in Pammal to ensure the buildings are safe—Photo: Special Arrangement

On Tuesday, anxious parents of Sri Sankara Vidyalaya in Pammal flocked to the school to find out what the school administration planned to do to make the school building safe for the students.

The concern was born out of an incident on Monday afternoon in which eight children, all of them class VI students, were injured after the roof packing on the first floor fell on them.

The school authorities acted swiftly, taking the students to a nearby hospital for treatment; the students were treated as outpatients and discharged.

According to the school administration, following the incident, a section of the first floor was cordoned off.

Weather-beaten building

Parents said the building was weather-beaten, as it had been built in 1993, and the recent floods had weakened it further.

Speaking to The Hindu , a spokesperson of the school said, “Only one girl child was injured to an extent that she needed a ‘suture’ on her back. All of them were sent home after the incident. We have already planned to repair the entire structure during the summer holidays this year, which was conveyed to the agitated parents who agreed with the school management on this decision,” she said.
title: Roof fall sends parents scurrying to school
